title: Projects
text:
Below is a selection of academic, technical, and independent projects that demonstrate my skills in analytics, machine learning, research, and product thinking.



Type: Research + Machine Learning
This project explores how machine learning can be used to predict cognitive performance degradation under sustained stress. The goal is to model changes in reaction time, attention, and fatigue using physiological and behavioral features.
Key Focus Areas - Cognitive load modeling
- Feature engineering for high-stress signals
- Supervised ML models for performance prediction
Tools & Technologies Python, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, NumPy
Status: Research & model development in progress




Type: Product + UX + Analytics
Designed the concept for a cognitive tracking system for motorsport drivers that visualizes reaction time, fatigue, and post-race performance insights.
Key Features - Reaction time and fatigue scoring
- AI-generated post-race debrief
- Performance trend visualization
- UX design optimized for high-pressure environments
Tools & Technologies UX Research, Figma, Python (planned), Data Visualization , Streamlit
Status: Concept & design phase




Type: Analytics & Optimization
Built an optimization model to maximize Net Present Value (NPV) for residential real estate investments over multiple quarters.
Key Focus Areas - Revenue forecasting
- Cost optimization
- Decision-based modeling
Tools & Technologies Excel Solver, Regression Models, Financial Analysis
Context: Academic project (Applied Business Analytics)





Type: Machine Learning & Business Analytics
Created a machine learning model to estimate Customer Lifetime Value and segment customers based on predicted value.
Key Focus Areas - Revenue impact analysis
- Customer segmentation
- Model interpretability
Tools & Technologies Python, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Data Visualization
Status: Model and dashboard development in progress

Each project reflects my focus on combining analytical rigor, real-world applicability, and thoughtful design. I continuously update this portfolio as I build and refine new work.

title: About
text:
About Me
Hello! I’m Kriti Singh, a graduate student at Boston University pursuing a Master’s in Applied Business Analytics.
My interests include:

Machine learning

Cognitive performance research

Neuroanalytics

Motorsport data

Data-driven decision making

UX/UI design

Cloud tools like AWS

I’m passionate about using data and AI to understand how humans think, react, and perform — especially in high-pressure environments like motorsports, hospitals, and racing simulations.
My goals:

Build industry-level analytics projects

Publish research papers in cognitive performance ML

Develop UX/UI + AI-driven tools

Create a cognitive tracker app for motorsport drivers

Work as a data scientist or ML engineer

This website is a growing portfolio that showcases my projects, skills, and ongoing research.

title: Contact
text:
Contact
I’m always open to discussing projects, research collaborations, internships, and analytics opportunities.
You can reach me through the following channels:

Email: kriti@bu.edu

GitHub: https://github.com/KRITISIN-GH

Feel free to connect — I’m happy to share more about my work and experiences.
